info.title: AWSBillingConductor
info.description:
Amazon Web Services Billing Conductor is a fully managed service that you can use to customize a pro forma version of your billing data each month, to accurately show or chargeback your end customers. Amazon Web Services Billing Conductor doesn't change the way you're billed by Amazon Web Services each month by design. Instead, it provides you with a mechanism to configure, generate, and display rates to certain customers over a given billing period. You can also analyze the difference between the rates you apply to your accounting groupings relative to your actual rates from Amazon Web Services. As a result of your Amazon Web Services Billing Conductor configuration, the payer account can also see the custom rate applied on the billing details page of the Amazon Web Services Billing console, or configure a cost and usage report per billing group.

This documentation shows how you can configure Amazon Web Services Billing Conductor using its API. For more information about using the Amazon Web Services Billing Conductor user interface, see the Amazon Web Services Billing Conductor User Guide.

servers.description: The AWSBillingConductor endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)
The AWSBillingConductor endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)

post.description: Describes a pricing rule that can be associated to a pricing plan, or set of pricing plans.

allOf.description: The billing period for which the described pricing rules are applicable.
The name of a pricing rule.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) used to uniquely identify a pricing rule.
The pricing rule description.
The scope of pricing rule that indicates if it is globally applicable, or if it is service-specific.
The type of pricing rule.
A percentage modifier applied on the public pricing rates.
If the Scope attribute is SERVICE, this attribute indicates which service the PricingRule is applicable for.
The pricing plans count that this pricing rule is associated with.
The time when the pricing rule was created.
The most recent time when the pricing rule was modified.
The seller of services provided by Amazon Web Services, their affiliates, or third-party providers selling services via Amazon Web Services Marketplace.
Activate or deactivate Amazon Web Services Free Tier application.
The possible Amazon Web Services Free Tier configurations.
The possible Amazon Web Services Free Tier configurations.
The set of tiering configurations for the pricing rule.
The set of tiering configurations for the pricing rule.

Usage type is the unit that each service uses to measure the usage of a specific type of resource.

If the Scope attribute is set to SKU, this attribute indicates which usage type the PricingRule is modifying. For example, USW2-BoxUsage:m2.2xlarge describes an M2 High Memory Double Extra Large instance in the US West (Oregon) Region. 

</p>

Operation is the specific Amazon Web Services action covered by this line item. This describes the specific usage of the line item.

If the Scope attribute is set to SKU, this attribute indicates which operation the PricingRule is modifying. For example, a value of RunInstances:0202 indicates the operation of running an Amazon EC2 instance.

items.description: A representation of a pricing rule.

allOf.description: A list containing the described pricing rules.
The pagination token that's used on subsequent calls to get pricing rules.

BillingPeriod.description: The preferred billing period to get the pricing plan.

Filters.description: The filter that specifies criteria that the pricing rules returned by the ListPricingRules API will adhere to.

allOf.description: A list containing the pricing rule Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) to include in the API response.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of pricing rules to retrieve.

NextToken.description: The pagination token that's used on subsequent call to get pricing rules.

post.description: A paginated call to get a list of all custom line items (FFLIs) for the given billing period. If you don't provide a billing period, the current billing period is used.

allOf.description: The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) for custom line items.
The custom line item's name.
The custom line item's fixed charge value in USD.
A representation of the charge details that are associated with a flat custom line item.
A ListCustomLineItemFlatChargeDetails that describes the charge details of a flat custom line item.
The custom line item's percentage value. This will be multiplied against the combined value of its associated resources to determine its charge value.
A representation of the charge details that are associated with a percentage custom line item.
A ListCustomLineItemPercentageChargeDetails that describes the charge details of a percentage custom line item.
The type of the custom line item that indicates whether the charge is a fee or credit.
A representation of the charge details of a custom line item.
A ListCustomLineItemChargeDetails that describes the charge details of a custom line item.
The custom line item's charge value currency. Only one of the valid values can be used.
The custom line item's description. This is shown on the Bills page in association with the charge value.
The product code that's associated with the custom line item.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that references the billing group where the custom line item applies to.
The time created.
The most recent time when the custom line item was modified.
The number of resources that are associated to the custom line item.

items.description: A representation of a custom line item.

allOf.description: A list of FreeFormLineItemListElements received.
The pagination token that's used on subsequent calls to get custom line items (FFLIs).

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of billing groups to retrieve.

NextToken.description: The pagination token that's used on subsequent calls to get custom line items (FFLIs).

Filters.description: A filter that specifies the custom line items and billing groups to retrieve FFLI information.

allOf.description: A list of custom line items to retrieve information.
The billing group Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) to retrieve information.
A list of custom line item ARNs to retrieve information.

post.description: A paginated call to retrieve a summary report of actual Amazon Web Services charges and the calculated Amazon Web Services charges based on the associated pricing plan of a billing group.

allOf.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a billing group.
The actual Amazon Web Services charges for the billing group.
The hypothetical Amazon Web Services charges based on the associated pricing plan of a billing group.

put.description: This updates an existing pricing plan.

The name of the pricing plan. The name must be unique to each pricing plan.
The new description for the pricing rule.

The most recent time when the pricing plan was modified.

Name.description: The name of the pricing plan. The name must be unique to each pricing plan.

post.description: A list of the pricing plans that are associated with a pricing rule.

post.description: Deletes a pricing plan. The pricing plan must not be associated with any billing groups to delete successfully.

allOf.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the deleted pricing plan.

Arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the pricing plan that you're deleting.

post.description: This updates an existing billing group.

The name of the billing group. The names must be unique to each billing group.
A description of the billing group.

The number of accounts in the particular billing group.
The most recent time when the billing group was modified.
The status of the billing group. Only one of the valid values can be used.
The reason why the billing group is in its current status.
Specifies if this billing group will automatically associate newly added Amazon Web Services accounts that join your consolidated billing family.
Specifies if the billing group has the following features enabled.
Specifies if the billing group has automatic account association (AutoAssociate) enabled.

parameters.name: ResourceArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the resource to list the tags.

post.description: Associates the specified tags to a resource with the specified resourceArn. If existing tags on a resource are not specified in the request parameters, they are not changed.

parameters.name: ResourceArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to which to add tags.

delete.description: Deletes specified tags from a resource.

parameters.name: ResourceArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to which to delete tags.

parameters.name: tagKeys
parameters.description: The tags to delete from the resource as a list of key-value pairs.

Usage type is the unit that each service uses to measure the usage of a specific type of resource.

If the Scope attribute is set to SKU, this attribute indicates which usage type the PricingRule is modifying. For example, USW2-BoxUsage:m2.2xlarge describes an M2 High Memory Double Extra Large instance in the US West (Oregon) Region. 

</p>

Operation is the specific Amazon Web Services action covered by this line item. This describes the specific usage of the line item.

If the Scope attribute is set to SKU, this attribute indicates which operation the PricingRule is modifying. For example, a value of RunInstances:0202 indicates the operation of running an Amazon EC2 instance.
